greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: If A_k denotes the first 3^k terms, then A_0 = 0, A_{k+1} = A_k A_k B_k, where B_k is obtained from A_k by interchanging 0's and 1's.
comment: Called the Mephisto Waltz sequence (or the Mephisto Waltz infinite word).
May also be obtained by starting with 0 and iterating the morphism 0 -> 001, 1 -> 110.
The sequence gives A_oo. For the concatenation A_0, A_1, A_2, ... see A134391.
reference: J.-P. Allouche and J. Shallit, Automatic Sequences, Cambridge Univ. Press, 2003, p. 25.
Konrad Jacobs, Invitation to Mathematics, Princeton, 1992; pp. 105-106 and 215.
link: Joerg Arndt, Matters Computational (The Fxtbook), section 38.1.2, pp. 729-730
J. Endrullis, D. Hendriks and J. W. Klop, Degrees of streams.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Mephisto Waltz Sequence
maple: for n from 1 to 6 do S:=f(S): od:
mathematica: Nest[ Flatten[# /. # -> {#, #, Abs[# - 1]}] &, {0}, 5]  (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Sep 27 2011 *)
xref: Cf. Thue-Morse sequence A010060, A001285. Number of 0's in A_k gives A007051, number of 1's is A003462. See also A064991.
results.author: Michael Gilleland (megilleland(AT)yahoo.com), Oct 31 2001
ext: Corrected by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jun 14 2010, at the suggestion of Chris Erickson
